6Hteeq-ltXQA56wlBFX_2g.text: My friend and I came here yesterday after the movies and from the start received really good and friendly service, though with a couple of mishaps - incorrect drinks being brought and after the starter came, etc. We forgave them though as on the whole, along with the food, it was great. We shared the gyozas and a new prawn dish for starters, I had the Yasai Pad Thai for a main and it was delicious and my flatmate had the Salmon Teriyaki. He had the apple, celery and mint juice drink which was divine and I enjoyed the orange berry juice which also was lovely but i had drink envy after tasting his!! Would definitely return.

kLA8limoRQ3_c38s_9T5lA.text: I don't give a damn is a restaurant is a chain.  I only care if the food is good.....The food is good.I've heard about Wagamama for years and only this time in London did I have the chance to try it.  I had the spicy fried rice with beef bowl (also with egg and kimchi) and it was quite tasty.  I added just a bit of the chili oil to give it a kick.  Also had a cup of jasmine green tea.  Yummy for the tummy.Service was very good and the price of the meal was very reasonable.Overall a great experience and I would most definitely return if given the opportunity.

vnFEbRUJFt74o9zmHl8hYw.text: Really good for what it is! It's very tailored to a western palette, but I did enjoy it a lot!The noodle soups are delicious and really generous portions for England. My only slight complaint is the lack of spice, even the hot sauces they brought over to us were a little bland.

2kmrzHgSqOe4QZRvVFpAWQ.text: I knew it was going to be mediocre.  I had heard all the talk about how bland, oily, and generally low quality the food is... but it's lunch in Canary Wharf... I got desperate.I'm not telling you that you aren't allowed to slum it out at Wagamama when you get desperate for something different.  But ask yourself, is it really worth it?  Doesn't it make more sense to tough it out, eat something healthy for lunch, then get some quality food for dinner somewhere far far away from here?

K6X95QBVJ9aYvddKVPNZ9Q.text: This particular location in Canary Wharf probably has the best customer service I've ever received in London. The food is great, the service is great, and it's clean and efficient.In fact, I think I'll go here for lunch today.

dnrB72HhNk0e6S18F7YSlw.text: As usual, Wagamama does not disappoint and lives up to its reputation for good portions for reasonable prices. The waiting staff were very prompt and friendly. Food arrived in a timely manner, and the quality was consistent with other Wagamamas.

DvTiLku3tObjwfxL5rrRXA.text: Too expensive for lunch and too boring for dinner. The food is decent but once you tried one dish, you've had them all, wish the menu had more to offer.

fSmYl4S0fJuqozfW2R1aUw.text: Horrible.  I can't even explain why right now because I'm still too emotional.  Just never go here. It's not good for groups, it's not good for children, it's not good for individuals, it's not good for adults.

kaGEwY83OvL_H1s25VUfcQ.text: Anybody who likes budget noodles and a canteen ambiance must give Wagamamas a try. Located all over the UK, this is great value for money. In the Wharf this place can get extremly busy, which makes this one less enjoyable than others I have eaten in. Almost too in-and-out for my liking.

001OtZd01w0jx052BsOm9Q.text: Now i am quite fond of waga's, pretty reliable and all that. Tasty fills a hole. But go to this one at your peril I'd say. It wasn't worth the chopsticks you were eating with. Everything seemed to be reheated, the noodles definately were and I was told that this was because they were busy - but how long can it take to cook noodles for goodness sake, they were all stuck together and pretty rough. My chap got his meal 20 mins before mine and the dim sum were chewy when they were meant to be crispy. What's more the manager didn't really seem to care.Shame really. Don't bother going though.

NpLM0H9VETf0GTqNC2isiQ.text: Quite a large wagamamas when i went it was quite late so it was not too busy. i was not impressed when they kept mixing up our orders with the table next to us, and when my noodles arrived after a very long wait they were cold! I had seen them sitting on the counter for at least 5 mins and complained to waitress she offered to warm them up but i rejected as my friends had finished there meals i got a refund :)and they gave me a doggy bag to take my noodles home in which i popped in the microwave later that night as a midnight snacknothing tastes better then free noodles!

ybnbjhTMkq8BFhy3wjQKvg.text: I really don't like Wagamama. All my friends used to go mad over this place, but I could never understand what they saw in it. I've been twice. The first time it was average. I went more recently and it was really rubbish. I suppose this is why they don't go on about it any more. Granted, it has a nice location in Jubilee Place and the staff are lovely! I've never experience another Wagamama so am not sure what to compare the standard to, but I have been turnt off eating at another one elsewhere!

4lC_6OQ3kEUk1pnKJbH8aA.text: In my mind, this is one of the best Wagamamas in London. The food is really good here, I think some of the noodle soups or ramen, are better than at other Wagamamas. I've been here quite a few times, and have always experienced this. The food is always really hot, and just like all the Wagamamas the choice of drink is one of the best features. The juices are very good, and refreshing. The location isn't amazing in terms of views/scenery, but it is handy. Its located in the Cabot Square shopping centre, so if you come up from Jubilee line exit, take a left before the escalators to enter the shopping centre and you will eventually find it on your right. One thing I must praise here is the service standards. You really spend very little time waiting for food to arrive. The orders are taken quickly and the food arrives within minutes. My favourite Wagamama!

OByaLu611Vx7s9gel0WIZQ.text: Food here is always great but menu is slightly confusing

BodD6jVuAfPNgf_DPmWEVg.text: The food here is always good and well priced. I woudn't say cheap but its worth the price it is. If you look on their site sometimes you can find vouchers for money off.

q5JBdaxUifd0IYy8PBGZXw.text: Service? What service? Having been to several wagamammas in the past, this branch has to be the worst of the lot. The staff in this location either have not been trained or paid and they do try to show you that, poor attitude when showing you to a table, giving a menu or when ordering food. Their ignorance to their own store's promotions is astounding too. Despite the food being alright, this is really not a place I would want to bring any friends or relatives to - plenty of other options nearby.

jv2zNBw9zx3QfdNC_bXk4Q.text: Great food. If you are hungry, want something fairly inexpensive you can come here (or to any of the wagamammas - it being a chain) and know you will get lots of great tasting food at a cheap price. What's more it also seems to be fairly healthy too. There is a wide choice, it often takes me ages to decide what to have, so much of it looks good, but a lot of it is quite spicy food so it may not be up everyones street. The layout is fairly basic, but quite nice. Everyone sits on long tables, so any kind of intimacy is out, you wont get away with private conversations here! However what it does mean is that you can get seated very quickly. Even when queues are long you never seem to have to wait for ages.Service is quick. You'll be in and out before you know it!

NSmwYANaO8hzeLEkdYCoxA.text: This wagamama is bad for service. Oh my god it's bad. We went for lunch one day and my boyfriend asked for another drink and the guy said in quite a brusque manner 'in a minute', walked off and never came back. I was shocked. I love Wagamamas, go the Croydon one on a Sunday and the staff are lovely and I think this is why this one seems so bad because it's such an exception from the standard of the normal wagamama experience. And some of the staff were very good. We did complain and we did get an apologetic cringeworthy letter but I'll never go back to that one.

N5KICkQh4G07CyWs1AKiKA.text: this is a great waga's.the staff are really friendly and I have always been seated fairly quickly. as with most waga's the food arrives when it is cooked, so your party may not all eat at once, but its usually no more than 2-3 minutes between dishes so not going to kill you!the dishes are as they are for all waga's: simple, tasty and varied. there are rice, noodles, soup noodle dishes - and then varying types of noodle. the menu has a glossary of terms to avoid confusion.this branch is in the heart of canary wharf, inside,close to the shops. a great place to stop for lunch after a heavy day shopping - or somewhere to go before the o2 perhaps? only a couple of tube stops!

KkPPLEsRNB8tQX8GCFk_6A.text: Terrible food, terrible service. We got in and waited about 10 minutes before our presence was acknowledged, even with no one ahead of us. The food came out quickly but was bland and tasteless. I've had a lot of ramen in my day and this has got to be the worst I've experienced. Their miso broth is some sort of homeopathic, 1 part per billion concoction. Their noodles aren't ramen noodles, they're more like spaghetti noodles. It tasted like spaghetti noodles in water. After a couple bites and exchanging dishes to confirm the mediocrity all around, we left to find some real food.

l6w8Feup9CxkbF_OCt124A.text: Simple, easy and cheap. A friend and I decided to meet for an impulsive dinner and wanted cheap and cheerful. In the area there isn't many options and I always have a hankering for noodles and gyoza so wagamamas suited that perfectly.The Canary Wharf branch is large, with long benches - as the norm. We were seated quickly and as it wasn't overly busy, could choose our table and had our own space and area for the entire evening.The food came out quickly and service was on point. In and out in an hour.I opted for the pulled pork gyoza and the yaki soba. Both were enjoyable and the pulled pick actually had more of a Peking duck flavour to it which was nice. Sure Wagamamas is a chain and the quality isn't up there with the best of London but for quick and easy food it was spot on and just what we needed!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Gyoza NOM!
Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Chilli squid
Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Yaki soba

LuqwIzkeXUdtIgTGEzpslA.text: I came here for lunch with coworkers and we were unanimously disappointed with the service and food here. Wagamama is a chain that serves Asian dishes. The branch at Canary Wharf is pretty large. My coworkers and I came at 11:45AM and were seated right away. By 12:15PM, the restaurant was packed. There seems to be a lot but still a shortage of staff because the waiter who initially took our orders never came back. It was hard for us to track down a waiter, whether it was to order, have our waters refilled or getting the bill. I ordered a pad thai but was really confused with the flavors I was getting from this dish. The flavors were also pretty bland. We also shared a fried squid. This was alright. The flavors were there but the texture of the squid was quite rubbery. Overall, poor service and inauthentic food at Wagamama although conveniently located. I won't be voluntarily coming back again.

dhma0bCRbSmJFNETOJwl5w.text: I'm not generally a big fan of Japanese food, but I do love some Teriyaki!  I was skeptical when I came here with friends, but thankfully I was not disappointed!  The teriyaki here was very tasty but not in the style I'm used to.  And that's not a bad thing!  The wait staff was helpful and very friendly and the atmosphere was casual and fun.  I had a good meal for a moderate price and enjoyed myself thoroughly!

Ybc7nq3qCvImeSbRwaf9pg.text: Do you like dog food? I don't mean the hearty, crunchy kibble which, although I have not tried it, even if it were not that good would provide a satisfying 'crunch' to it, but I mean like the wet food out of the can. If you do, this place will likely be rather excellent for you as they create piles of mush that defies the laws of normal, human food. Had the 'soba noodles with salmon' and found out that they were not, in fact, soba noodles. I looked at the plates of garbage around me and found myself wondering why I had ended up in this situation? I would imagine if one had committed a rather egregious and violent crime in a nordic country, they would send you to a prison with much better food than this.Still - the people lined up. We are in a mall above a swamp so perhaps this is the logic? That said, there is the new crossrail area which does have good food - this place should be skipped. At all costs. Unless, as I've mentioned, you like dog food. Then hurry over - you never know if a place that serves garbage that looks like dog food will stick around very long.

GpKzJT5bqQBdaQ6MWwXuZQ.text: Wagamama's can always be relied on for good, quick food.The pad thai wasn't quite as good as I had hoped but still enjoyed it!The wine menu is surpsiringly good!

nPj7uqNJDIviozeulhhTyQ.text: Went for lunch with a friend for the first time to a Wagamana branch, and I really enjoyed everything. Food was very good -- I ordered the chilli prawn with rice, and it was really flavourful. We also had duck gyoza, and it went very nicely with the plum sauce it was served with. Service was surprisingly good and quick. We went at the peak of the lunch hours, and the place was rather crowded, but our food arrived promptly and the servers were on top of their game. Not much to comment on ambience -- it is what it is being a chain. One downside was that it was quite loud, so I had to almost shout throughout the conversations. Overall, very good and I'd definitely go back.

fVr7zuC18KThoI9ZzzEuuw.text: Shrimp Appetizer was really good but my Ramen seemed to be really bland  tasting. Shrimp was bland chicken we bland I hated the tofu mussels were ok pork belly was ok but nothing to rave about. Poor UK

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom

y8ej3Bvy7rk4FSEI6Gu50Q.text: Great place for ramen lunch. The sirloin and short rib ramen are a slam dunk if you are looking for a decent amount of beef. Casual cool dining room and fast, friendly service.

EZAqYKan9wT-B4wVjgvRAA.text: Been to this particular Wagamamas quite a few times before. We always go in the evening so I have never had to queue.It's great for a quick, tasty meal! The staff are all very friendly and attentive and the service is quick!Standard Wagas set-up, communal benches and tables, very plain and simple, very clean and tidy in the Canary Wharf restaurant. The food always tastes good, its yummy, clean Japanese inspired cuisine, I would recommend- the juices, the Pulled Pork Gyoza, Edamame, Chicken Katsu Curry and the Ginger Chicken Udon.

3RHB0E1dYf3qlZyWJkB2gA.text: It's a chain - based largely on noodles.  If you like fast-food asian noodles - this is your spot.  Good location. Good vibe.  Decent service at family tables.  I wanted to like it more.  But, while I'm a huge fan of asian flavors - I'm not so much of those that replace more proteins and veggies with noodlies... which this kind of does.

Fdo5FZqsXAMphT2TtnJZRQ.text: Not bad. U can find wagsmama nearly everywhere in London. It's good for lunch and light dinner. Recommend vegetarian dishes, which are seasoned well and tasty.

NF2HldZqmfevU-gYyVylGw.text: Food in Wagamama is not bad, but it is not great either. This place is good for a quick meal...my favorites are the chili squid, Wagamama ramen and Yaki Udon. They are served in generous portions so it is worth the price as long as you are not looking for something fancy. Service is always quick and good here!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Chili Squid & Wagamama Ramen

n-nXdSe7dHLSbeBOKNx1Vw.text: Asian fusion place with good and fast service - its passable as an option but I think I will always opt for something else if available. Had the wagamama ramen which was underwhelming. Mom had the buri bowl which was actually quite nice with brown rice. Will try their yakisoba and chili squid next to see if it has better options

mcd_6aeTUDA7t1ZVBZcl5g.text: Quick, fast lunch spot. I got the chicken kare lomen which was a curry coconut soup with noodles seemed like ramen). It tasted fine but could have used more veg. Broth could have had more flavour but overall, not a bad lunch option.

FUZE7uWv3hVY8Sn8YimcBw.text: Good food for a chain. Can be pricey if you order more than two sides. Since I'm vegetarian,  I have to basically order sides. My husband loves the fried squid. Exceptionally speedy service and the wait staff are very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Yasai katsu - excellent suggestion for a vegetarian by Maeve our server.

F45q3Zde3bHhpZyPVJYCHw.text: I have been to the Canary Wharf Wagamama a number of times and used to love it - quick service, massive portions, not bad value for money, free green tea. But then I decided to check the calorie content in their food and was shocked. According to their own website, they manage to pack an astonishing amount of calories into some fairly innocent looking foods. E.g. Grilled duck ramen (grilled meat in a soup, you'd think it would be decently healthy) is 990 calories, that's like two bigmacs. Most curries are over 1k calories. And don't tell me about the macros - these are not all good calories. So if you don't care about this kind of stuff - you will enjoy this place. If you do - order wisely.

wh-_GX4Rqf7dMfYXyilaBw.text: Wagamama is such a fun restaurant!  Located in the underground Jubilee Place Mall, this restaurant "sits" above the GBK.  For a chain, the food is outstanding, and the prices are very reasonable (especially for the expensive city of London).  On a Sunday for lunch this Wagamama wasn't too busy, so my friends and I were seated at one of their long picnic-type tables by ourselves.  During the height of weekday lunch you may be seated with strangers, but that just adds to the fun...perhaps you'll be seated next to a tall dark stranger in a business suit.  You never know.  We snacked on some edamame with salt before our entrees arrived.  I loved my Chicken Tama Rice...it was a nice size portion and so yummy!  If I lived in London, I'd eat at Wagamama at least once a month.  Hint: Green Tea is free...but you have to know to ask for it.  :)

jjI7JEef4HjAhct8x3F8oQ.text: Wagamama, oh how the mighty have fallen.There was a time, back in 1994, when one could go to Wagamama in Coptic Street, have to queue for 15 minutes or so just to sit down, but get a Ramen and drink for less than £5.I don't think anything on the menu is less than £5 anymore.Now, the wagamama offering is still tasty for the most part, but the entire menu seems to be constructed from the same basic ingredients that are strung together in different ways, so it's like lego fast food made to look like properly prepared meals.The Canary Wharf branch is among the worse ones, because it ALWAYS has a queue, which really puts me off going there most of the time.

nMJMAWe5e_cnRkU51F0Iyg.text: Right lets get straight to the point!Fantastic customer service!Immaculate restaurant!Yeah the menu confusing but hey! Ive come here for one meal and one meal only and that is...wait for it...CHICKEN KATSU CURRY.....seriouly AMA-ZING!Chicken breast wrapped in panko bread crumbs were tender and crispy and soooo good.The curry was dancing its flavours in my mouth, the sticky rice had the right stickiness and the salad was fresh. I mean what a wonderful meal! It topped off my Bday well.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - Canary Wharf, London, United Kingdom. Chicken katsu curry

JvuXLiEPh_rxjJWe4rL_Gw.text: Fast service, but noisy ambience. Food is decent when you stick with a few options. Some staff are very helpful..others need a bit more training.
